intro: Commelina eckloniana subsp. echinosperma, commonly known as the spiny-fruited spiderwort, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while the inflorescence consists of a cluster of small, delicate flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its spiny, spherical fruits that contain the seeds.
